meanings.definition: The process of pressing paper or cloth between rollers to create a smooth surface.
meanings.sent1: The calendering of the paper made it feel very smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The factory used calendering to make the cloth shiny and flat.
meanings.sent3: The calendering machine decided to take a break after working hard all day.
meanings.sent4: Her skilled hands moved like a calendering machine, smoothing out any imperfections.
meanings.sent5: The calendering process transformed the rough fabric into a luxurious material.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging events or activities in a schedule.
meanings.sent1: She was in charge of the calendering for the upcoming conference.
meanings.sent2: Calendering the appointments helped him stay organized throughout the week.
meanings.sent3: The calendering of the school play rehearsals was a juggling act.
meanings.sent4: His calendering skills were so precise, he never missed a deadline.
meanings.sent5: The calendering of the project timeline ensured everything ran smoothly.
